subclusters.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial electron transport as primary ROS source causing cumulative molecular damage leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as endogenous source and ionizing radiation as exogenous ROS source accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production and damage feedback loop impairing mitochondrial function and hormone biosynthesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondria as main ROS source and oxidative damage driver in aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial electron transport chain as major superoxide producer linked to lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS production to age-related decline in aerobic efficiency and mitochondrial damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS as major source of oxidative damage affecting gamete function and offspring health.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-related increase in mitochondrial superoxide production causing biomolecular damage and insufficient antioxidant defense.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation and redox homeostasis disruption as causes of replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses oxidative damage accumulation from ROS byproducts of metabolism and antioxidant roles in lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS generation and oxidative stress as determinants of lifespan in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS as primary oxidative damage source with complex roles in aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage to nuclear and mitochondrial DNA and decline in repair mechanisms driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights NADPH oxidase (Nox4) as alternative ROS source causing oxidative DNA damage and replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes ROS and RNS from multiple sources causing oxidative/nitrosative stress and cardiovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on imbalance of antioxidant enzymes regulating ROS, especially H2O2 accumulation, leading to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: NADPH Oxidase-Derived ROS Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in antioxidant defenses leading to oxidative damage and functional impairment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical-induced lipid and protein oxidation in brain aging and protective heme oxygenase response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS-driven oxidative damage in brain aging and neurodegeneration, with antioxidant therapy focus.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses lipid peroxidation biomarkers (F2-isoprostanes) to demonstrate systemic oxidative stress in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows antioxidant-rich diets improve brain function by mitigating ROS-induced oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Demonstrates antioxidant supplementation reduces oxidative damage and extends lifespan in model organisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights antioxidants as modulators of free radical damage and aging, with lifespan extension evidence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory with Lipid Peroxidation
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes free radical oxidative damage accumulation and antioxidant roles in slowing aging-related functional decline.
